ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I have specific health goals in mind
I know what strategies to use to reach my health goals
I can come up with a solution if I get stuck solving a problem
I am not able to focus on the same topic for a long period of time
I can make fast decisions (e.g., in lessons)
I am well-organized. For example, I am good at planning what I need to do during a day
I am easily distracted
I often react too fast. I have done or said something before it is my turn
My thoughts easily wander
It is difficult for me to sit still
It is easy for me to come up with abdifferent solution if I get stuck when solving a problem
Notes: It is easy for me to come up with a different solution if I get stuck when solving a problem.

ElementDescription: I am full of new ideas
It takes a lot of effort for me to remember things
I often forget what I have done yesterday
I often lose things
I am curious, I want to know how things work
